text: Anatomy of a Toastmasters Meeting Timer 7 Toastmasters Meeting Toastmaster 1 Impromptu Table Topics Speakers 2 Topicsmaster 3 Speeches Speaker #1 Speaker #2 Speaker #3 4 Evaluations Evaluator #1 Evaluator #2 Evaluator #3 5 General Evaluator 6 Reporting Roles Ah-Counter 8 Grammarian 9 Other Roles 10 Description 1. The Toastmaster is the meetings host and director. 2. Table Topics Speakers are guests or members without a meeting role that are looking to improve their impromptu speaking skills. 3. The Topicsmaster runs the Table Topics section of the meeting. They choose participants and select topics for each speaker. 4. Members plan and write five- to seven-minute speeches that they deliver during club meetings. 5. Evaluators provide verbal and written feedback on speeches. Each speaker has an evaluator. 6. The General Evaluator provides feedback on the overall meeting, the evaluations given by the evaluators, and offers areas of improvement. 7

. 7. The Timer times speeches, Table Topics, and evaluations and provides a report at the end of the meeting. 8. The Ah-Counter counts filler words each speaker uses and reports on them at the end of the meeting. 9. The Grammarian chooses a word of the day and helps speakers improve their grammar and vocabulary. 10. Some clubs have their own unique meeting roles. Ask a club officer about what these roles are and how you can fill them! 2020 Toastmasters International. All rights reserved.
